title: Chi-Squared GOF Test
question_text:
The vegetable sales at a local convenience store last year broke down as follows: $34\%$ broccoli, $21\%$ peas, $18\%$ carrots, $17\%$ cabbage, and $10\%$ beans.
Recently a random sample of $123$ vegetable-buying customers found that $39$ bought broccoli, $23$ bought peas, $20$ bought carrots, $17$ bought cabbage, and $24$ bought beans. A chi-squared goodness of fit test was performed.
Determine the test statistic, $p$-value, and degrees of freedom.

choices.text:
Test statistic:
23.42 P
-value:
0.01 Degrees of freedom:
122
